paragraphs.text:
%md
## Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!
### We've all been there.   We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute.   A bottle of wine is always a good option.   But which one?   There are so many!   And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift.   Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likely to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $30).  
##### Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 <https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews>  
#### Updated: October 2020, Authors:  Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujini

msg.data:
Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!

We've all been there. We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute. A bottle of wine is always a good option. But which one? There are so many! And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift. Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likely to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $30).

Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews

Updated: October 2020, Authors: Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujini

##### 4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy
##### 5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

1. Explore the data
2. Define the Target Attribute (GT_90_Points vs. LT_90_Points)
3. Find the Key Attributes that Most Influence GT_90_Points_Bin)
4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy
5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Business Problem

#### Based on previous wine reviews and data about price, province, variety and other wine attributes, build a predictive model to identify wines most likely to have points > 90.

msg.data:
Business Problem

Based on previous wine reviews and data about price, province, variety and other wine attributes, build a predictive model to identify wines most likely to have points > 90.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Data Preparation

msg.data: Data Preparation

paragraphs.title: Add POINTS_BIN column
paragraphs.text:
%sql
ALTER TABLE WineReviews130K_bin ADD POINTS_BIN VARCHAR2(15);

paragraphs.title: Populate POINTS_BIN column as Greater than 90 points and Less than 90 points
paragraphs.text:
%script

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'GT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID
        FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT
        WHERE WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.POINTS >= 90 and WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'LT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID
        FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT
        WHERE WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.POINTS < 90 and WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

%sql
select * from WineReviews130K_bin;

58740	US	Ros?? of	91	25	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Lynmar 2015 Ros?? of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Lynmar	GT_90_Points	This wine sings in the glass, offering substantial aromas and flavors of charcuterie, dried herb and orange creamsicle, conjuring up visions of picnics in a glass. 110462	US		88	16	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Three Rivers 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))	Sauvignon Blanc	Three Rivers	LT_90_Points	The fruit sourcesƒ??Klipsun and Gamacheƒ??are excellently displayed in this white that includes 8% S??millon. 84735	France		88	12	Bordeaux	Bordeaux		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Ch?›teau Turcaud 2010  Bordeaux	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Ch?›teau Turcaud	LT_90_Points	Densely textured, this has firm and dark tannins. 35181	Canada		90	19	British Columbia	Okanagan Valley		Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Quails' Gate 2013 Chenin Blanc (Okanagan Valley)	Chenin Blanc	Quails' Gate	GT_90_Points	Tart and lively, this lip-licking Chenin includes 9% Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. 87127	US	La Coupelle Single Vineyard	96	60	California	Arroyo Grande Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Laetitia 2013 La Coupelle Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)	Pinot Noir	Laetitia	GT_90_Points	A wondrous bottling of delicately handled, incredibly complex wine, this bottling shows tangy cranberry, black raspberry, butter cookie, wet sage, rosemary, menthol and green peppercorn on the nose. paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:

6359	Australia	Bin 28 Kalimna	93	30	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Penfolds 2012 Bin 28 Kalimna Shiraz (South Australia)	Shiraz	Penfolds	GT_90_Points	Named for one of Barossa's top vineyards, this blends fruit from Barossa, McLaren Vale, Clare Valley and Langhorne Creek into a splendid warm-climate Shiraz. It's full bodied, dense and dusty in texture, with rich dark-fruit flavors of dates, blackberries and blueberries. Hints of baking spices and mocha from the barrel-aging should integrate nicely over the next several years. Drink 2017ƒ??2025.
2312	Australia		90	33	Western Australia	Pemberton		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Picardy 2006 Chardonnay (Pemberton)	Chardonnay	Picardy	GT_90_Points	From a little-known region of Western Australia, this is a restrained, structured example of Chardonnay that may drink well for 5ƒ??6 years. Subtle vanilla and bacon shadings upfront add nuance to the melon and pear aromas. Flavors are of soft, fully ripe tree fruit and melon, but held in check by citrusy notes and crisp acids.
2587	Australia	Poison Hill Vineyard	90	35	Western Australia	Frankland River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Frankland Estate 2012 Poison Hill Vineyard Riesling (Frankland River)	Riesling	Frankland Estate	GT_90_Points	The most aromatically complex of the FE 2012 Rieslings, the Poison Hill offers beguiling scents of tangerine sherbet and Earl Grey tea. It's almost too perfumy for its soft, medium-bodied structure and slightly dusty-textured finish, but those floral elements are also its appeal. Drink nowƒ??2020+.

It's slightly dusty on the finish, making it food-friendly, ending with hints of cocoa and coffee. Drink nowƒ??2018.

This blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Shiraz and 20% Mourv??dre features intriguing notes of cola, brown sugar and cinnamon layered over a plush base of ripe black cherries. It's mouthfilling and round, with a soft, licorice-tinged finish. Drink nowƒ??2018.

652	Australia		92	21	Western Australia	Great Southern		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Plantagenet 2014 Riesling (Great Southern)	Riesling	Plantagenet	GT_90_Points	Based on this example and a few other informal tastings, 2014 will be a top vintage for Rieslings from Western Australia. 2517	Australia	RunRig	94	225	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Torbreck 2010 RunRig Shiraz-Viognier (Barossa Valley)	Shiraz-Viognier	Torbreck	GT_90_Points	A perplexing wine to evaluate, the 2010 RunRig (97% Shiraz and 3% Viognier) evolves rapidly once poured, going from slightly stewed and overoaked to a wine that shows considerable class within 20 minutes or so. 107228	Australia	Unwooded	86	17	Western Australia	Western Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	West Cape Howe 2011 Unwooded Chardonnay (Western Australia)	Chardonnay	West Cape Howe	LT_90_Points	Like so many unwooded Chardonnays, this is a medium-bodied, pleasantly fruit-forward wine that's clean, simple and direct. Tangerine scents lead into flavors of mixed citrus and a crisp finish. Drink now.
100466	Australia		82	14	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia				Terra Australis 2008 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)	Chardonnay	Terra Australis	LT_90_Points	Fresh grassiness, interwoven with a mineral note and aromas of apple and pear make for an elegant opening. The rather dilute palate shows a surprising level of spritz but also some burnt orange flavors while the short finish betrays a hint of sweetness.
105290	Australia	Single Vineyard Unoaked	85	15	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2007 Single Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)	Chardonnay	Yangarra Estate Vineyard	LT_90_Points	Streamlined and tart, this is a citrusy version of Chardonnay that showcases unadorned lemon and pineapple flavors.
100469	Australia		81	5	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia				Banrock Station 2006 Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)	Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon	Banrock Station	LT_90_Points	This bargain-basement Australian is oddly lacking in fruit, offering up herbaceous and pine scents instead. Flavor is likewise scarce on the crisp palate and the short finish. No tannins in sight.
102378	Australia	Beginning Single Vineyard	87	25	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	The Lane 2014 Beginning Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)	Chardonnay	The Lane	LT_90_Points	This is a plush, rounded wine, lacking much edge or cut, yet concentrated and flavorful. Roasted hazelnuts and cashews frame creamy pineapple fruit, ending in soft ripples of citrus. Drink now.
108390	Australia	Enchanted Path	87	75	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Mollydooker 2014 Enchanted Path Shiraz-Cabernet (McLaren Vale)	Shiraz-Cabernet	Mollydooker	LT_90_Points	Combine masses of American oak with high ripeness and the result is this warm woody wine oozing with vanilla, molasses and cedar. It's full and plush, but lacks complexity and cellaring potential. Drink it now.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
6262	US	Reserve	95	140	Washington	Walla Walla Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Leonetti Cellar 2010 Reserve Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Leonetti Cellar	GT_90_Points	Leonetti's 2010 Reserve includes 52% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 9% Cabernet Franc and 9% Malbecƒ??a more complex blend than the 2009. It opens with a lovely floral aromaƒ??a bouquet of clover and white flowersƒ??then heads for the dark side, with black cherry and cassis. It's a big, tannic wine, beautifully crafted, and clearly differentiated from the winery's regular Cabernet bottling.
6263	US	Quail Hill Vineyard	95	55	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Lynmar 2011 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)	Chardonnay	Lynmar	GT_90_Points	This wine could easily be mistaken for French Chablis. It's notable for the tight, nervous feeling that acidity and minerals combine to stimulate, and the finish is very dry. There is, fortunately, a great heart of sweet tropical fruit, like the purest golden mango pur??e, ripe and succulent and honeyed. Terrific now, but such is the balance that this could be one of those Chardonnays that changes in interesting ways over the next 5ƒ??6 years.
6455	US	Levitation	91	40	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Sleight of Hand 2010 Levitation Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))	Syrah	Sleight of Hand	GT_90_Points	Though quite different stylistically from the 2009, this is just as good. The structure in 2010 is noteworthy for its high acid focus. There are streaks of berry and cassis, with touches of smoke and espresso. This is a wine to cellar while you are drinking up the delicious 2009.
6456	US	The Enchantress Old Vine	91	28	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Sleight of Hand 2010 The Enchantress Old Vine Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)	Chardonnay	Sleight of Hand	GT_90_Points	It's rare that domestic Chardonnay is truly Chablis-like, but this delicately framed wine fits that description perfectly. Nuanced with mineral and spice notes, this has melon and apple flavors that seem to sail on a gentle sea breeze. It doesn't slam you with oak, instead it seduces with you style.
6458	US	Cinghiale Vineyard	91	75	California	Sonoma Coast	Sonoma			Del Dotto 2009 Cinghiale Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)	Pinot Noir	Del Dotto	GT_90_Points	This is big in fruit, big in tannins and big in the overall impression it leaves. It's enormously rich and ripe in cherry, red currant and cola, sprinkled with dusty exotic spice and a hint of forest herb. The vineyard is the former Maritime Vineyard of the W.H. Smith Winery, whose Pinot Noirs were magnificent and scored highly. This one seems a little heavier than Smith used to produce.
6461	US	Final-Final	91	27	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Efeste 2009 Final-Final Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah	Efeste	GT_90_Points	This shows the textural depth of all the Efest?? wines. A floral top note gives way to firm, dark, cassis and blackberry flavors. Light notes of herb, anise and earth are introduced and set comfortably into the lengthy finish. It has great power and flavor, with the possibility of cellaring for a decade or more.
8549	US		93	40	California	Carneros	Napa-Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Ram's Gate 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)	Chardonnay	Ram's Gate	GT_90_Points	Dark gold in color, this appellation wine is tropical and salty, medium bodied with a strong taste of lemon preserves. Its fuller, richer nature is complemented by fresher streaks of grapefruit and mandarin, with a mineral component of wet stone.
8552	US	Seven Leagues	93	46	California	Santa Maria Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Scar of the Sea 2014 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)	Pinot Noir	Scar of the Sea	GT_90_Points	Though this is their appellation blend, Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli don't hold back, offering elegant aromas of rose petals, purple flowers, rich pomegranate fruit, rusty strawberries and light vanilla on the nose. The palate begins with a light cranberry-raspberry flavor that deepens into tart mulberry before showing dried rose petals, uncrushed clove and a lava-rock minerality.
8294	US	Cave Block Reserve	92	49	California	Santa Cruz Mountains	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Wrights Station 2013 Cave Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)	Pinot Noir	Wrights Station	GT_90_Points	Beet and dark cranberry juice make for a very deep red-fruit entry to this bottling that is lifted by bay leaf, thyme and anise on the nose. It's easy, clean and refreshing in a lighter style on the sip, with dried strawberry and red plum spiced up by star anise and fennel.
8919	US	Estate	92	50	California	Dry Creek Valley	Sonoma			Fritz 2005 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Fritz	GT_90_Points	Showing the rustic tannins and peppery spices that Dry Creek Cabs usually possess, this Cab wants a little time in the cellar. With black currant, chocolate, tobacco and herb flavors, it's very close in quality to the winery's regular '05 Cab, with a little more concentration and a firmer tannin structure.
7041	US	McCrone Vineyard	92	50	Oregon	Willamette Valley		Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Ken Wright 2008 McCrone Vineyard Pinot Noir	Pinot Noir	Ken Wright	GT_90_Points	Still quite young, but showing real depth and layering, the McCrone vineyard designate offers pomegranate and raspberry fruit, dusted with baking spices, and finished with a tasty vein of mocha. This is a wine to enjoy in the full bloom of its youth.
4514	US	Single Vineyard	95	72	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Donum 2013 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Donum	GT_90_Points	The producer's Russian River Valley fruit comes from the Winside Vineyard, planted long ago by Anne Moller-Racke and Joe Nugent. It astounds in this must-have wine, complex and ridiculously velvety in texture. Pepper, clove and cardamom ride huge waves of baked fruit and mocha, with the structure to age through at least 2026, but why wait when it's so delicious now?
6265	US	Sori Bricco Vineyard	95	80	California	Diamond Mountain District	Napa			Von Strasser 2010 Sori Bricco Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Von Strasser	GT_90_Points	This is an enormous Cabernet, as packed with intensity and power as anything in Napa Valley. The vineyard is Von Strasser's highest on the mountain, which maximally exposes it to the sun, and you can taste the solar ripeness in the intense essence of black currants and dark chocolate. The tannins exhibit classic Diamond Mountain potency. This is a dense Cabernet that needs serious time in the cellar. Hold until 2019, and it will continue to develop for many years afterward.
6267	US	Lucille Late Harvest	94	18	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Stottle 2011 Lucille Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)	Viognier	Stottle	GT_90_Points	This tastes like a more concentrated and sweeter version of Stottle's dry Viognier from the same vintage and vineyard. Deeply concentrated, complex and creamy, it's loaded with citrus and stone fruits, honey and butterscotch, yet remains lifted by defining acidity.
6268	US	Appassionata	94	75	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Dr. Loosen & J. Christopher 2007 Appassionata Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)	Pinot Noir	Dr. Loosen & J. Christopher	GT_90_Points	Dense and extracted, this dark, loamy Pinot Noir is concentrated and challenging. The fruit is black, compact, and sheathed in flavors of loam. Layers are tight and a bit unyielding. There is depth and power here, but it must be extracted over time and with a bit of patience.
6270	US	Limited	94	150	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Silverado 2009 Limited Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Silverado	GT_90_Points	This is a barrel selection, presumably limited in cases. It's an extraordinarily rich, concentrated 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, made in the modern cult-style of massively extracted blackberries, black currants, cassis liqueur and chocolate, with oak bringing the usual sweet toast and vanilla complexities. This deserves its high score for sheer opulence and great Napa structure. Delicious now, and could easily age for at least 10 years.
6729	US	Joy! Ros??	94	160	California	Green Valley	Sonoma			Iron Horse 1996 Joy! Ros?? Sparkling (Green Valley)	Sparkling Blend	Iron Horse	GT_90_Points	This Brut-style wine feels extraordinarily refined in the mouth, with a silky, airy texture. The flavors of toffee, butterscotch, orange marmalade and vanilla bean are rich, but balanced with yeasty bitterness and bright acidity. Gorgeous to drink now, anywhere, anytime, with practically anything. Pricey, yes, but worth it for special occasions.
6824	US	Paraboll	91	48	California	Anderson Valley		Virginie Boone	@vboone	Londer 2010 Paraboll Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)	Pinot Noir	Londer	GT_90_Points	Still a very young wine, Londer's Paraboll is leathery and herbal, marked by swirls of bright cranberry and rhubarb flavor. With a full, silky mouthfeel and long finish, it's one of the best of their 2010s to seek out. This should gain complexity with a few years more of age.
8920	US	Cinq Cepages	92	75	California	Sonoma County	Sonoma			Chateau St. Jean 2004 Cinq Cepages Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Chateau St. Jean	GT_90_Points	Fans of CC will find a wine with the balance of previous vintages. It refuses to be a fruit bomb, but offers a wealth of sumptuous blackberry and cherry liqueur flavors that pull back at the last moment under a blanket of youthful tannins. Not a long-term ager, but should hold for 6 years, and is easy to find, with more than 13,000 cases produced.
8923	US	Deep Red	92	40	California	Mendocino				Paul Dolan 2005 Deep Red Red (Mendocino)	Red Blend	Paul Dolan	GT_90_Points	The descriptor Deep Red perfectly captures the essence of this blend of Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Syrah and Grenache. It's rich and full-bodied, with expressive, complex red wine flavors of red and black currants, spiced red plums, crushed pepper and hints of dark chocolate and anise. The tannic structure is wonderfully soft and intricate. Drink this beautiful wine now and for the next several years.
8926	US	La Petite Etoile	91	20	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Chateau St. Jean 2006 La Petite Etoile Fum?? Blanc (Russian River Valley)	Fum?? Blanc	Chateau St. Jean	GT_90_Points	This bottling continues to impress after all these years with its complexity and sheer deliciousness. The '06 shows charred barrel fermentation notes of pungent, smoky wood, but there's a great heart of citrus, melon and pepper spice flavors that makes the wine rich and rewarding. It's made even better by zesty acidity and a bone-dry finish.
4517	US	Julia's Vineyard	95	45	California	Santa Maria Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Byron 2013 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)	Pinot Noir	Byron	GT_90_Points	Bruised strawberries and ripe red plums are leveled by iron, ginger snaps, crushed slate and soy on the umami-laden nose of this bottling by Winemaker Jonathan Nagy. Intriguing river--stone minerality powers the palate, where black plums and olallieberries meet with black spice and lots of florality.
4521	US	Durell Vineyard Origin	95	48	California	Sonoma Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Three Sticks 2014 Durell Vineyard Origin Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)	Chardonnay	Three Sticks	GT_90_Points	This is a beautiful display of Durell's greatness, crafted from two blocks of the vineyard, one planted to Old Wente, the other in one of the site's most rocky and windy areas. Combined, it offers well-integrated notions of golden apple, pear and honey amidst a freshness of acidity and unobtrusive oak, just the slightest suggestion of nutmeg-dusted brioche on the finish.
6271	US	Harmonie	94	120	California	Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak	Sonoma			Capt?¯re 2010 Harmonie Red (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Capt?¯re	GT_90_Points	Capture continues to make progress in interpreting their vineyard located in this new appellation, a high elevation overlooking Alexander Valley. Based on Cabernet Sauvignon, this Bordeaux-style blend is young now, with hard tannins that interfere with the fruit. The fruit is intensely concentrated with cherry compote and cassis flavors, while new oak's vanilla and toast are proportionate to the wine's volume. A worthy followup to the 2009, and a wine to cellar for 8ƒ??10 years, if not longer.
4069	US	Clone 877.4.369.362	90	29	California	El Dorado	Sierra Foothills	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Miraflores 2012 Clone 877.4.369.362 Red (El Dorado)	Rh??ne-style Red Blend	Miraflores	GT_90_Points	Here is a hefty, concentrated, satisfying wine to pair with big proteins. A dense red-black color, with aromas of blackberry jam and dried plums lead to bold fruit flavors, full body and a thick, nicely tannic texture. The intense plum and blackberry character lasts through the lingering finish.
4072	US		90	19	California	Dry Creek Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Pech Merle 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)	Sauvignon Blanc	Pech Merle	GT_90_Points	Made in a stainless-steel, grassy style, this features a charming balance of peach and apricot buzzing in the background to maintain the fruit amidst the natural acidity. Delightfully drinkable, it finishes lean and crisp.
8095	US	The Pundit	93	25	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Tenet 2014 The Pundit Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))	Syrah	Tenet	GT_90_Points	Directly appealing, this wine is bursting with aromas of plum, red currant, herb and spiceƒ??all showing freshness and purity. The palate is packed to the brim with supple fruit flavors, full of density and weight, while never getting bogged down. It hits the delicious gong hard.
8096	US	S&M Caliza Vineyard	93	55	California	Paso Robles	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Brian Benson 2013 S&M Caliza Vineyard Syrah-Mourv??dre (Paso Robles)	Syrah-Mourv??dre	Brian Benson	GT_90_Points	Concentrated boysenberry notes meet with intense aromas of purple flowers, especially lavender, on the nose of this blend of 78% Syrah and 22% Mourv??dre. A zesty acidity and silky tannins present a wide range of flavors on the complex palate, from blackberry and pepper to tarragon, mint and anise.
9026	US		91	24	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Ken Wright 2012 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)	Pinot Blanc	Ken Wright	GT_90_Points	Pinot Blanc in a warm year such as 2012 veers closer to the fruitiness of Pinot Gris, as shown here. Barrel fermented in French oak, it remains sleek and crisply defined, with pure fruit flavors of golden apple and ripe pear.
9404	US		93	75	California	Fort Ross-Seaview	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Foretell 2012 Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)	Pinot Noir	Foretell	GT_90_Points	Stemmy wet forest and a distinct note of mushroom opens this exotic wine, a full-bodied and concentrated expression of the coast. Tangy orange and juicy rhubarb flavors support the searing acidity that balances the wine and keeps it fresh and lively on the palate.
9651	US	Melville Vineyard	91	64	California	Sta. Rita Hills	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Foxen 2013 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)	Pinot Noir	Foxen	GT_90_Points	Surprisingly shy in aromas at first, this eventually releases pleasing elements of mace, nutmeg, star anise and red cherry. The palate is softly lush and earthy, with black rocks, heavy black plum, hoisin sauce, boysenberry and a cola character. With quite strong structure, this will smooth and grow more delicious with time. Drink 2018ƒ??2028.
9656	US		90	28	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Merryvale 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)	Sauvignon Blanc	Merryvale	GT_90_Points	While barrel-influenced and full-bodied, this unctuous wine remains crisp in edgy acidity, with lean flavors of lemon and grapefruit amidst a deeper, richer background of oak and caramel.
7183	US		90	49	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Cult X 2011 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Cult X	GT_90_Points	It's bone dry, acidic and tannic in youth, but with a solid core of black cherries and red currants, and the oak has been subtlely applied. Give it until 2019ƒ??2020.
7185	US	M??tier	90	44	Washington	Red Mountain	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Doyenne 2011 M??tier Red (Red Mountain)	Rh??ne-style Red Blend	Doyenne	GT_90_Points	This southern Rhone-style blend consists of 35% Mourv??dre, 40% Grenache and 25% Syrah. Steely minerality underscores pretty cherry fruit, with a light and peppery streak of herb running through the tannins.
7186	US	Signature	90	42	Washington	Red Mountain	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Doyenne 2011 Signature Syrah (Red Mountain)	Syrah	Doyenne	GT_90_Points	The winery's most-available Syrah is co-fermented with a splash of Viognier. The fruit is tight and compact, clean with red and black berry flavors, framed by firm, polished tannins.
7188	US		90	35	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Emblem 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Emblem	GT_90_Points	Rich and velvety, it carries an important mouthfeel consisting of firm tannins, good acidity and a firm, minerally grounding. Fruit is the star, filling the mouth with blackberries and black currants, and a smoky coating of oak. With a dry finish, it's drinking very well now, and will soften through 2018.
4074	US	VIneyard Riserva	90	36	California	Temecula Valley	South Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Robert Renzoni 2011 VIneyard Riserva Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)	Sangiovese	Robert Renzoni	GT_90_Points	Leather and cooked meats open the nose of this wine from Southern California that also shows aromas of blackberry extract. Once sipped, it offers dark and dense flavors of sweet tar, concentrated violets and a pinch of lavender, all held together by grippy tannins.
4075	US	Heritage	90	30	California	Sonoma County	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Roth 2012 Heritage Red (Sonoma County)	Red Blend	Roth	GT_90_Points	Several varieties figure into this blend, from 26% Zinfandel and 21% Syrah to smaller amounts of Merlot, Petite Sirah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Big and powerful in smoky leather and black currant, it offers a rich softness on the palate, with a tightly wound savory, peppery aspect to the finish.
4077	US	San Lorenzo Estate	90	60	California	Alexander Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Seghesio 2012 San Lorenzo Estate Red (Alexander Valley)	Red Blend	Seghesio	GT_90_Points	A 60% majority of Zinfandel plays nicely with 40% Petite Sirah, blending into a happy union of big, ripe blackberry and thick tannins. Smooth on the palate, with a touch of vanilla, it highlights red and black fruit in complementary waves, staying juicy throughout.
4079	US		90	53	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Stags' Leap Winery 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Stags' Leap Winery	GT_90_Points	Rounded by small amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, this Cab is earthy and lean on entry, before developing in the glass into juicy dark cherry and leathery notes. Smooth, integrated oak and tannin leave an impression in terms of texture, with a persistence of tannin on the finish.
7751	US	Courtney's	91	35	California	Sta. Rita Hills	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Lincourt 2014 Courtney's Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)	Chardonnay	Lincourt	GT_90_Points	Caramel-laced buttercream, marshmallow, cotton candy and sweet almond milk show on the nose of this bottling, named after one of Bill Foley's daughters. It's fairly light in body on the sprightly palate, where burnt marshmallow and vanilla flavors reign over the citrus elements.
8101	US		93	35	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Lynmar 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)	Chardonnay	Lynmar	GT_90_Points	An impressive blend of different vineyard sites, given a touch less oak than many of the producer's single-vineyard selections, this wine doesn't skimp on flavor nor complexity. It weaves steely minerality into warmer layers of nutmeg, apple and preserved lemon.
8106	US	Pisoni Vineyard	93	75	California	Santa Lucia Highlands	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Testarossa 2014 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)	Pinot Noir	Testarossa	GT_90_Points	Crushed slate, plush rose petals, red cherry, smoked beef, vanilla and a slightly feral quality arise on the nose of this bottling from the region's most iconic vineyard. There is great tension on the sip, with tart plum skin, bright raspberry and dark cranberry fruit meeting with black spice, sandalwood and incense flavors. Acidity binds it all together.
7525	US	The Evening Standard	92	45	California	Marin County	North Coast	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	McEvoy Ranch 2012 The Evening Standard Pinot Noir (Marin County)	Pinot Noir	McEvoy Ranch	GT_90_Points	An excellent medium-bodied wine from an estate better known for its olives, this is dark in color but with a lighter, tawny rim. The complex aromas combine sweet baking spices with ample cherry and berry notes. Flavors kick in with juicy strawberry, dark cherry and subtle shadings of nutmeg and wood smoke. The texture is plush and almost soft, and the taste is warmly luxurious.
8298	US	Old Vine	92	18	California	Mendocino County		Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Artezin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)	Zinfandel	Artezin	GT_90_Points	ƒ??Wowƒ?� is the first word that comes to mind when tasting this superconcentrated and immensely fruity wine. It practically overwhelms the nose and the palate with ripe, jammy boysenberry and blackberry, sprinkled with licorice and black-pepper nuances that add attractive complexity. It's a big wine all the way, but not extreme in alcohol.
7193	US	INOX Unoaked	90	20	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Chehalem 2016 INOX Unoaked Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)	Chardonnay	Chehalem	GT_90_Points	Aged entirely in stainless steel tanks, this carries a light touch (7 g/L) of residual sugar but remains sharp, even edgy, with bright acidity and pine needle highlights. Ripe apple and pineapple flavors carry through the clean and refreshing finish.
6697	US		91	25	California	Sonoma Coast	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	La Crema 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)	Pinot Noir	La Crema	GT_90_Points	This is an impressive wine at the price and production level, a great go-to for multiple occasions. It delivers earthy, candied strawberry around a light, bright core, remaining soft and smooth in texture and intensity, finishing with a tease of milk chocolate.
7756	US	Animo	91	85	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Michael Mondavi Family Estate 2013 Animo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Michael Mondavi Family Estate	GT_90_Points	Brawny in tannin weight and grip, this tight-knit wine is impressively built and in tune with the vintage and its embrace of strength and complexity. Chalky texture is highlighted in tart mountain cherry, graphite and vanilla laced in clove. Enjoy best 2023ƒ??2033.
7505	US	The Phantom	92	48	California	Temecula	South Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Lorenzi Estate 2011 The Phantom Red (Temecula)	Red Blend	Lorenzi Estate	GT_90_Points	This blend of Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot and Petite Sirah offers suave aromas of cherry, vanilla and white chocolate. The palate is dense with fudge flavors as well as black-cherry sauce, dark chocolate, slight bits of chopped mint and decent acidity to clean it all up.

3648	US	Solomon Hills Special Bottling Two Barrels Made	93	50	California	Santa Maria Valley	Central Coast			Ojai 2006 Solomon Hills Special Bottling Two Barrels Made Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)	Chardonnay	Ojai	GT_90_Points	With 15% residual sugar, this dessert wine is decidedly sweet in apricot, pineapple, pear, honey, vanilla fudge and smoky flavors, with a brisk minerality. It maintains a zesty balance, with crisp acidity.
2888	US		91	34	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Bunnell 2009 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))	Grenache	Bunnell	GT_90_Points	Spicy and floral, with pretty cherry fruit concentrated at the core, this inviting Grenache combines grace and power. The flavors are complex and concentrated, with hints of green tea, cut tobacco, and a finishing streak of espresso and cocoa.
2663	US	Conner Lee Vineyard Conflict	90	55	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	J. Bookwalter 2010 Conner Lee Vineyard Conflict Red (Columbia Valley (WA))	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	J. Bookwalter	GT_90_Points	Conflict is two thirds Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot, and 8% Cabernet Franc. Smoke wreathes around deep cherry candy flavors, leading into some chewy tannins dusted with savory herbs.
2664	US	Cold Creek Vineyard	90	30	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Januik 2011 Cold Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))	Chardonnay	Januik	GT_90_Points	This lush Chardonnay has a certain oiliness to the aromas, along with dusty, toasty components that ride through a soft, plush mid-palate. The fruit is a rich mix of peach and apricot, highlighted with toasted hazelnuts, vanilla and coconut.
2667	US	Vintage Brut	90	45	California	Yountville	Napa			Chandon 2008 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Yountville)	Sparkling Blend	Chandon	GT_90_Points	This sparkling wine is one of the best from Chandon in years. There's a soft refinement to the mousse, making it just as good as its more expensive rivals. Shows complex flavors of yeast, limes, oranges, vanilla and honey.
5630	US	Obsidian Ridge Vineyard	90	27	California	Red Hills Lake County				Obsidian Ridge 2005 Obsidian Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills Lake County)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Obsidian Ridge	GT_90_Points	This is the best Obsidian Cab since the 2002, and for similar reasons. It was a good vintage for Cabernet. The wine is rich and peppery and lush in black currant flavors, with beautifully sculpted, ripe tannins. Provides more evidence that this Red Hills of Lake County appellation has enormous potential for Cabernet.
5127	US	Indian Springs Ranch Reserve	92	34	California	Sonoma Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Haraszthy 2013 Indian Springs Ranch Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)	Zinfandel	Haraszthy	GT_90_Points	This sultry, big-boned wine offers deft aspects of black pepper and dried herb atop a softly layered touch of brown sugar. Richness is there, as is a voluptuous flirtatiousness, yet it remains dry and dusty on the palate and classically varietal.
4620	US	Sequestered	94	40	California	Santa Maria Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Orfila 2014 Sequestered Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)	Pinot Noir	Orfila	GT_90_Points	Hearty aromas of black cherry and mulberry meet with rustic iron, dark spice, crushed slate and dried sagebrush on the expertly woven nose of this bottling by a Southern California-based vintner. The palate balances bright acidity with upright tannins, allowing the dark-red fruit and mace spice flavors to shine.
4086	US	Stonetree Vineyard	90	25	Washington	Wahluke Slope	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Locus 2012 Stonetree Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)	Syrah	Locus	GT_90_Points	Cocoa, vanilla and baking spice aromas lead off this wine, along with plum. On the palate rich, textured dark fruit flavors intermingle with barrel spices. The fruit and oak have equal footing.
4344	US	Huckleberry's Vineyard	90	65	California	Sonoma Coast	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Talisman 2013 Huckleberry's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)	Pinot Noir	Talisman	GT_90_Points	From a tiny coastal vineyard, this wine appears light-bodied and delicate at first, building its power slowly in the glass. Sous bois, earthy spice and savory tea give it an edginess unfettered by fruit, while a healthy tannic structure keeps it grounded.
3650	US	Estate Bottled	93	30	California	Chalk Hill	Sonoma			Chalk Hill 2006 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Chalk Hill)	Sauvignon Blanc	Chalk Hill	GT_90_Points	Near perfect in the way it tastes almost sweet, then pulls back into dryness. The flavors of pineapples, green apples, pears, peaches and honeysuckle are made even more delicious by the judicious application of new oak and sur lie aging.
3651	US	Thompson Vineyard	93	45	California	Santa Barbara County	Central Coast			Ojai 2004 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)	Syrah	Ojai	GT_90_Points	Here's a big, rich, densely layered Syrah, the kind of wine that Cab or Merlot lovers who are looking for alternatives should discover. It's full-bodied, dry and oaky, yet with its cherry, chocolate, fig and licorice flavors, offers a whole different flavor profile. Brilliiant with pork tenderloin with a fruity sauce or stuffing.
3654	US	Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red Wine	92	60	Washington	Red Mountain	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Andrew Will 2005 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red Wine Red (Red Mountain)	Red Blend	Andrew Will	GT_90_Points	A classic Bordeaux blend. Tight and chewy, this fragrant wine adds whiffs of tobacco to its red currant and cherry fruit. It is a beautifully shaped wine, precise and balanced, compact and intriguing. It will reward decanting and should be cellared for a few years to give maximum enjoyment.
3658	US	Reserve Melange	92	75	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Prix 2004 Reserve Melange Red (Napa Valley)	Red Blend	Prix	GT_90_Points	Rich in red currant, cassis, licorice, cola, vanilla cream and smoky oak flavors, with a smoothly tannic texture, this wine seems to be Cabernet-based. It's made solidly along Napa cult Cab lines, a softly voluptuous wine that's delicious now, and should age well for many years. From Hagafen.
3661	US		92	50	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Pepper Bridge 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Pepper Bridge	GT_90_Points	The blend is classic Bordeauxƒ??85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec. It's got grip and a sensuous mix of wild herb, black olive and mountain berry. There is plenty of acid to support it, and winemaker J-F Pellet has been pulling back on the new oak, so that newer releases of Pepper Bridge are more structured and tilting more toward a European sensibility, which is to say, ageworthy.
2672	US		90	38	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Orentano 2009 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Orentano	GT_90_Points	Showing some mature notes at the age of four years or so, with a mellow texture framing cherry pie, cola and spice flavors. Feels silky, lush and delightful. Drink nowƒ??2015 as the fruit gradually fades away.
2675	US	Foreshadow	90	45	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	J. Bookwalter 2010 Foreshadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	J. Bookwalter	GT_90_Points	This is 89% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Merlot and 3% Syrah. It's toasty to the max, with scents and flavors of coffee and smoke as much as berry and cassis. There is great acid/tannin balance and some additional years of bottle age should help to bring out more of the fruit.
2677	US		90	15	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	L'Ecole No. 41 2012 S??millon (Columbia Valley (WA))	S??millon	L'Ecole No. 41	GT_90_Points	L'Ecole tackles, with great success, two of the least-recognized strengths of Washington viticulture: S??millon and Chenin Blanc. Here the blend includes 13% Sauvignon Blanc. It's well built, full bodied, with a mix of citrus and stone fruits, generous acidity, and some finishing skin flavors putting a slightly bitter frame around it.
2994	US	Pahlmeyer	91	50	California	North Coast	North Coast	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Jayson 2013 Pahlmeyer Chardonnay (North Coast)	Chardonnay	Jayson	GT_90_Points	A fresh-baked bread aroma and flavors like butter and baking spices make this full-bodied wine very attractive. It has ample acidity to balance the rich texture, and a lingering finish that completes the classic profile.
5134	US		92	20	California	Lodi	Central Valley	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Freakshow 2014 Red (Lodi)	Red Blend	Freakshow	GT_90_Points	Dark, dense with fruit flavor and thickly tannic, this full-bodied wine is a monument to concentration, ripeness and richness. Massive tannins are matched by huge jammy fruit, with a sense of layering and depth that is impressive and satisfying to experience.
4346	US	Super Tinto	90	22	California	Dunnigan Hills	Central Valley	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Tinto Rey 2014 Super Tinto Red (Dunnigan Hills)	Red Blend	Tinto Rey	GT_90_Points	Deep color, bold fruit aromas and substantial, spicy flavors lend significant power and concentration to this full-bodied wine. It's nearly dry, well structured and balanced, with appealing blackberry, nutmeg and cinnamon flavors.
4347	US	Estate Vineyard	90	25	California	Sonoma Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Wellington 2012 Estate Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)	Syrah	Wellington	GT_90_Points	Meaty and dense, this full-bodied red is expansive on the palate in well-defined layers of leather, blueberry and black pepper flavor.
4350	US	Estate	90	38	California	Sonoma Mountain	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Belden Barns 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)	Pinot Noir	Belden Barns	GT_90_Points	This wine is restrained on the nose and initially on the palate, showing a touch of reduction and tightly-held flavor. As it opens, it unleashes juicy dark cherry, berry and huckleberry notes, its core dense with tannin and oak.
2507	US	Ellen Lane Estate	95	75	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Paul Hobbs 2012 Ellen Lane Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)	Chardonnay	Paul Hobbs	GT_90_Points	Sunflower-gold in color, this heady, hedonistic Chardonnay brims with aromas of toasted brioche, lemon and herb. Bright and completely balanced, it invites sip after sip until there simply is no more. Concentrated and complex it finishes dry, lingering in beautiful layers on the tongue.
3005	US	Stagecoach Vineyard Synchrony	93	90	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Krupp Brothers 2009 Stagecoach Vineyard Synchrony Red (Napa Valley)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Krupp Brothers	GT_90_Points	This is rich and dense in blackberry and cherry jam, currant, mocha, anise and smoky cedar flavors. The mountain tannins are strong but refined, and the finish is long and spicy. It's a Bordeaux blend based on Cabernet Sauvignon, but be forewarned: It's high in alcohol.
3007	US		93	55	Washington	Walla Walla Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Pepper Bridge 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Pepper Bridge	GT_90_Points	A rich mix of red, blue and black fruit opens into a sappy, spicy midpalate. The lush fruits are highlighted by a wash of milk chocolate. At first tightly wound, the wine seems to show more oak flavors with air, hinting at licorice and Bourbon barrel.
5637	US	Estate Reserve	90	45	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Apolloni 2006 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)	Pinot Noir	Apolloni	GT_90_Points	The estate reserve is simply a barrel selection that the winery feels represents the top 10% of their estate-grown Pinot Noir. Basically it offers quite similar flavors; for the extra money you get more butterfat, more cherry fruit and a little less herb. What it gains in power, the wine loses in detail and nuance; depending upon your own palate preferences, the regular estate might be the better value.
5642	US	Estate	90	28	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Foppiano 2006 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Foppiano	GT_90_Points	Here's an elegant Pinot Noir that restaurateurs should buy for its food companionability. The mouthfeel has a lighter style than some Pinots. But it's packed with flavor, and is bone dry and crisp, making it ideal for steaks and chops or even Asian fusion. The flavors suggest cherries, black raspberries, root beer, tangerine zest, cloves, pepper and cinnamon.
5912	US	Monument Tree	95	50	California	Anderson Valley				Copain Wines 2009 Monument Tree Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)	Pinot Noir	Copain Wines	GT_90_Points	Outstanding. So dry and elegant, with such a deft, delicate texture, yet so explosive in fruit and spice. Bone dry, it has notes of herbs, cinnamon, raspberries and white pepper. A gorgeous, complex wine, one to think about and discuss.
5139	US		92	50	California	Sonoma Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Gundlach Bundschu 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Gundlach Bundschu	GT_90_Points	The producer sources primarily from its historic Rhinefarm Estate Vineyard for this wine, a rich expression of the variety opaque in color. Meat, black pepper, leather and tobacco give it a velvety lushness and concentration buoyed by complex, savory components. The lengthy finish is all about bittersweet chocolate.
4628	US	??dition Limit??e	94	65	Oregon	Dundee Hills	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Domaine Drouhin 2015 ??dition Limit??e Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)	Chardonnay	Domaine Drouhin	GT_90_Points	Domaine Drouhin's reserve-level Chardonnay puts new oak flavors front and center but backs them up with ultraripe fruit. A lush mix of tangerine, melon and peach notes combine, expanding across the palate. It's drinking quite well already but should continue improve through 2024.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
6437	Spain	Termanthia	95	200	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Numanthia 2009 Termanthia  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Numanthia	GT_90_Points	This Toro wine is a mindblower. The nose is exemplary: it bursts with smooth, rooty aromas of licorice, kirsch and roasted black plum. The palate is huge and tannic but luxurious, and the flavors of tobacco, cedar, lemon peel, spice and black fruit set up a finish with espresso, black cherry and a wall of tannins. Drink now through 2018.
9653	Spain	Reserva	90	40	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Lecco 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Lecco	GT_90_Points	Red fruit aromas are a bit rough and scalped in front of a chunky palate. Charred, burnt, oaky flavors of raspberry and cassis stress ripeness and weight before finishing with buttery oak, a slightly greasy feel and roasted berry flavors. Drink through 2020.
7179	Spain	Terrer d'Aubert	90	40	Catalonia	Tarragona		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vinyes del Terrer 2010 Terrer d'Aubert Red (Tarragona)	Red Blend	Vinyes del Terrer	GT_90_Points	This Catalonian blend is a concentrated number with a narrow, fruit-forward nose and cheesy leather on the side. The palate is full, grabby and ripe; flavors of blackberry and cassis are jammy and dark. It finishes sweet in flavor and ultraripe in feel, with a syrupy aftertaste. Another year or two in bottle will help this settle down; drink through 2020.
7189	Spain	Terra de Fic 2	90		Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Ferr?? I Catas?§s 2008 Terra de Fic 2 Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Ferr?? I Catas?§s	GT_90_Points	Initially, this comes across as being baked out and tired, but give it time to spread out and it reveals mature, earthy, leafy aromas and a round palate with choppy, firm tannins. Earthy flavors of dried cherry, Christmas spices and chocolate yield to licorice on the finish. Drink now.
4966	Spain	Els Ameliers	90	35	Catalonia	Terra Alta		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Lafou 2011 Els Ameliers Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)	Garnacha Blanca	Lafou	GT_90_Points	This is a really good showing for the Garnacha Blanca grape. The bouquet is fresh and not the least bit blowsy, with an emphasis on apple and pear aromas. The wine is plump, fruity and showing modest acidity, while flavors of apple and baking spices precede a finish that's easygoing. Drink now.
7690	Spain		90	22	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Finca La Mata 2011  Ribera del Duero	Tinto del Pais	Finca La Mata	GT_90_Points	Loamy, earthy blackberry and plum aromas are woody and attractive. This is loud and lively on the palate, with acidity and tannins making their presence felt. Blackberry and baked plum are the key flavors, and this finishes loamy and smooth. Drink through 2018.
7170	Spain		90	16	Northern Spain	Rueda		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Montespina 2013 Verdejo (Rueda)	Verdejo	Montespina	GT_90_Points	Fresh apple and lime aromas are pure as can be. This is chiseled, crisp and crystalline in the mouth, with lime, grapefruit and other citrus flavors. A long, firm, flavorful finish brings a slight hint of citrus  pith the longer it runs out.
7035	Spain	Almirez	92	22	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Teso La Monja 2007 Almirez  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Teso La Monja	GT_90_Points	Teso la Monja is the new Toro winery from the Eguren family of Rioja fame (former owners of Numanthia-Termes in Toro), and it's proof that no beat has been missed since they sold out to Mo?®t Hennessy. Expect dark, intense black fruit aromas and flavors mixed with heat, tannin, cola and spice. Some oak creeps out on the finish, but overall this is a lovely, bullish Toro. Drink now through 2014.
7677	Spain	Gran Reserva Brut Nature	90	35	Catalonia	Cava		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Castellroig 2009 Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)	Sparkling Blend	Castellroig	GT_90_Points	Toasty aromas include popcorn, scrambled egg and briny white fruits. There's smoothness to the ripe palate, while apple, peach and citrus flavorsƒ??the Big Three of cavaƒ??finish fruity and with stuffing. This is a ripe winner that's richer and more flavorful than your average brut nature.
2470	Spain	Gran Reserva	90	45	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Eduardo Garrido Garc??a 2004 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Eduardo Garrido Garc??a	GT_90_Points	Strawberry and raspberry aromas are a touch briny. This is lively in the mouth, with lasting acidity that offers kick to an aged Rioja. Spicy notes of pepper sit on top of base-level cherry and plum fruit, while toast and spice flavors along with lasting acidity drive the finish.
2864	Spain	Reserva	91	55	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Protos 2006 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Protos	GT_90_Points	Flower petal, mineral and blackberry aromas solidify the bouquet on this excellent Tempranillo. The palate is big and chewy, with fine balance and driving flavors of cherry, plum, vanilla and oak resin. With a finish that's bone dry and focused, this Ribera wine is ready to drink but can last another 5ƒ??8 years in a good cellar.
7380	Spain	San Rom?­n	92	70	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Maurodos 2007 San Rom?­n  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Maurodos	GT_90_Points	Bold as always, with a ton of cedar, graphite, blackberry, vanilla and coconut notes on the nose. This is huge, tough and ripe, with massive blackberry, caf?? mocha and vanilla flavors. It finishes hard but with a cascade of sweet fruit, marshmallow, coconut cake, herb and vanilla. Needs a few more years to settle. Drink after 2013.
7552	Spain	Taja Excelecia	91	23	Levante	Jumilla		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas M??hler-Besse 2005 Taja Excelecia Red (Jumilla)	Red Blend	Bodegas M??hler-Besse	GT_90_Points	Super smooth and complete on the nose, with black fruit, toasty oak and earth notes rolled into a nice whole. It's lush, plump and balanced, with full blackberry, raisin, chocolate and spice flavors resting in front of a mellow, spicy finish. A pretty, balanced blend of 75% Tempranillo and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon that shows Jumilla at its best.
7557	Spain	??N/2	90	25	Spanish Islands	Vi de la Terra Illes Balears		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	??nima Negra 2007 ??N/2 Red (Vi de la Terra Illes Balears)	Red Blend	??nima Negra	GT_90_Points	Roasted and baked on first blush, but then the wine's complexity and use of unusual Mallorcan grape varieties take over. Along the way there's flavors and aromas of prune, earth, leather, spice and Mediterranean terroir. It's also bringing tobacco and leaf notes to the table. A fun, different wine that goes nicely with tapas. Drink now through 2011ƒ??12.
2175	Spain	Flor de Muga	90	31	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Muga 2016 Flor de Muga Ros?? (Rioja)	Ros??	Muga	GT_90_Points	If you are of the school that says ros?? from Provence is the world's gold standard, then give this excellent newcomer a try. Brief skin contact has created a light color and sense of elegance on the nose and palate. Flavors of cantaloupe and peach are lightly sweet but cut by ample acidity. Drink as soon as possible to capture this wine's fresh essence.
2179	Spain	Gla?? Brut Nature	90	31	Catalonia	Cava		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Maria Casanovas NV Gla?? Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)	Sparkling Blend	Maria Casanovas	GT_90_Points	This aerated, yellow-tinted brut nature smells mature, bready and buttery. The palate is full bodied, yeasty and anything but sweet. Salted citrus and papaya flavors are nutty and hold steady on a slightly flat finish. Drink now.
2181	Spain	Reserva	90	30	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Eduardo Garrido Garc??a 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Eduardo Garrido Garc??a	GT_90_Points	Aromas of tobacco, wood grain, plum and cherry set up a plucky, lively palate with hard tannins. Spicy plum and berry flavors finish steady and drawing. Drunk now through 2023.
4378	Spain	Colecci??n Vivanco 4 Varietales	91	85	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Dinast??a Vivanco 2007 Colecci??n Vivanco 4 Varietales  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Dinast??a Vivanco	GT_90_Points	Tight on the nose, with dense aromas of black fruit, leather, dried cheese and earth. It's also fairly smoky and lively, with textured tannins, a generous mouthfeel and complex flavors of berry, pepper and spice. A lively, forward style made from Tempranillo, Graciano, Garnacha and Mazuelo.
7391	Spain	Solpost	92	23	Catalonia	Montsant		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Cellers Sant Rafel 2005 Solpost Red (Montsant)	Red Blend	Cellers Sant Rafel	GT_90_Points	A winner given its quality-to-price quotient. This smells earthy, dark and harmonious, with black plum and berry aromas leading the charge. It feels racy, juicy and full, with giant raspberry, plum, vanilla, tobacco and licorice flavors. It's textured on the finish, with bright, lasting flavors. Drink now.
6119	Spain	Reserva	92	35	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	12 Linajes 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	12 Linajes	GT_90_Points	Opening plum and raspberry aromas are complete and elegant, with dry earthy notes. This feels lush and layered with deep plum, raspberry and creamy oak flavors. Through to the finish, this is long, nicely oaked and complex in flavors and strong in structure and balance. Drink through 2021.
2683	Spain	Vi?ña Muriel Gran Reserva	90	50	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Muriel 2004 Vi?ña Muriel Gran Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Bodegas Muriel	GT_90_Points	Earthy, mildly leafy aromas of dried red fruits and vanilla are textbook for Rioja gran reserva. A medium-bodied palate shows balsamic richness along with flavors of prune, raisin, cassis and loamy earth. This is mild but solid on the finish, with a quick fade to the fruit component. Drink now.
2508	Spain	Vi?ña El Pison	95	300	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Artadi 2011 Vi?ña El Pison  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Artadi	GT_90_Points	Artadi's top wine is dynamite in a bottle. Ripe, saturated, oaky aromas of blackberry, leather, blueberry pie and aged cheese are incredibly potent and alluring. This is huge in the mouth, with lemony oak and broad tannins that don't grind. Intense blackberry, coffee, toast and smoky flavors finish a mile deep, with all sorts of textural grab and character. Best from 2016 through 2026.
667	Spain	Soplo	90	15	Levante	Valencia		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Rafael Cambra 2012 Soplo Garnacha Tintorera (Valencia)	Garnacha Tintorera	Rafael Cambra	GT_90_Points	Perfumed plum and raspberry aromas are slightly earthy and leathery. This is medium-to-full in body, with smooth, chunky tannins. Earthy, lightly baked plum and wild-berry flavors finish loamy and expansive. Drink through 2017.
4682	Spain	Propiedad	91	45	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Palacios Remondo 2011 Propiedad  (Rioja)	Garnacha	Palacios Remondo	GT_90_Points	Closed and in need of air at first, this takes on a ripe, medicinal, almost candied red-fruit nose. Next up is a full, wide-bodied palate with chunky plum and raspberry flavors. This old-vines Garnacha is ripe, tasty and all about the fruit. Drink through 2020.
5620	Spain	Morenita Cream	90	13	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Hidalgo NV Morenita Cream Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Hidalgo	GT_90_Points	Smooth and sweet, like a cream Sherry is supposed to be. 6713	Italy	Intense mint, menthol, ripe berry and dark spice aromas lead the nose. The palate offers dried black cherry mature raspberry, mint, thyme and clove alongside bracing tannins. Give this a few more years to reach its full potential. Drink after 2018.	Bussia	GT_90_Points	53	Piedmont	Barolo		Kerin Oƒ??Keefe	Nebbiolo	Deltetto 2011 Bussia  (Barolo)
6436	Italy	Vigna Paganelli shows amazing results with a bright fruit quality that translates into black cherry and blackberry. At the back are sophisticated tones of leather, tobacco and light touches of spice that give the wine depth and elegance. The most interesting aspect, however, is the mouthfeel that shows firm but beautifully ripe tannins that will help the wine age 10 years or more.	Vigna Paganelli Riserva	GT_90_Points	115	Tuscany	Brunello di Montalcino			Sangiovese Grosso	Il Poggione 2007 Vigna Paganelli Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
6437	Spain	This Toro wine is a mindblower. The nose is exemplary: it bursts with smooth, rooty aromas of licorice, kirsch and roasted black plum. The palate is huge and tannic but luxurious, and the flavors of tobacco, cedar, lemon peel, spice and black fruit set up a finish with espresso, black cherry and a wall of tannins. Drink now through 2018.	Termanthia	GT_90_Points	200	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	Tinta de Toro	Numanthia 2009 Termanthia  (Toro)
6262	US	Leonetti's 2010 Reserve includes 52% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 9% Cabernet Franc and 9% Malbecƒ??a more complex blend than the 2009. It opens with a lovely floral aromaƒ??a bouquet of clover and white flowersƒ??then heads for the dark side, with black cherry and cassis. It's a big, tannic wine, beautifully crafted, and clearly differentiated from the winery's regular Cabernet bottling. 6263	US	This wine could easily be mistaken for French Chablis. It's notable for the tight, nervous feeling that acidity and minerals combine to stimulate, and the finish is very dry. There is, fortunately, a great heart of sweet tropical fruit, like the purest golden mango pur??e, ripe and succulent and honeyed. Terrific now, but such is the balance that this could be one of those Chardonnays that changes in interesting ways over the next 5ƒ??6 years.	Quail Hill Vineyard	GT_90_Points	55	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma		Chardonnay	Lynmar 2011 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
6455	US	Though quite different stylistically from the 2009, this is just as good. The structure in 2010 is noteworthy for its high acid focus. There are streaks of berry and cassis, with touches of smoke and espresso. This is a wine to cellar while you are drinking up the delicious 2009.	Levitation	GT_90_Points	40	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	Syrah	Sleight of Hand 2010 Levitation Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
6456	US	It's rare that domestic Chardonnay is truly Chablis-like, but this delicately framed wine fits that description perfectly. Nuanced with mineral and spice notes, this has melon and apple flavors that seem to sail on a gentle sea breeze. It doesn't slam you with oak, instead it seduces with you style. 6458	US	This is big in fruit, big in tannins and big in the overall impression it leaves. It's enormously rich and ripe in cherry, red currant and cola, sprinkled with dusty exotic spice and a hint of forest herb. The vineyard is the former Maritime Vineyard of the W.H. Smith Winery, whose Pinot Noirs were magnificent and scored highly. This one seems a little heavier than Smith used to produce.	Cinghiale Vineyard	GT_90_Points	75	California	Sonoma Coast	Sonoma		Pinot Noir	Del Dotto 2009 Cinghiale Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
6460	France	Firm, concentrated and solid, this has a tight core that's surrounded by sweeter dark-plum fruit. This is ripe and full bodied, with a definite need for aging. 6461	US	This shows the textural depth of all the Efest?? wines. A floral top note gives way to firm, dark, cassis and blackberry flavors. Final-Final	GT_90_Points	27	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah	Efeste 2009 Final-Final Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

8549	US	Dark gold in color, this appellation wine is tropical and salty, medium bodied with a strong taste of lemon preserves. GT_90_Points	40	California	Carneros	Napa-Sonoma	Virginie Boone	Chardonnay	Ram's Gate 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)
8551	Austria	A whiff of passion fruit on the nose immediately hints at ripeness. The palate fulfils that promise not only with generosity but counters it with gorgeous grapefruit freshness and a lovely zesty texture that makes this very appetizing. The flavors are zingy, clean, ripe and very, very long. It is the grapefruit spice that gets you in the end.	Lindberg Reserve	GT_90_Points	51	Kremstal			Anne Krebiehl?ÿMW	Gr?¬ner Veltliner	Salomon-Undhof 2015 Lindberg Reserve Gr?¬ner Veltliner (Kremstal)
8552	US	Though this is their appellation blend, Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli don't hold back, offering elegant aromas of rose petals, purple flowers, rich pomegranate fruit, rusty strawberries and light vanilla on the nose. The palate begins with a light cranberry-raspberry flavor that deepens into tart mulberry before showing dried rose petals, uncrushed clove and a lava-rock minerality.	Seven Leagues	GT_90_Points	46	California	Santa Maria Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	Pinot Noir	Scar of the Sea 2014 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
8294	US	Beet and dark cranberry juice make for a very deep red-fruit entry to this bottling that is lifted by bay leaf, thyme and anise on the nose. It's easy, clean and refreshing in a lighter style on the sip, with dried strawberry and red plum spiced up by star anise and fennel.	Cave Block Reserve	GT_90_Points	49	California	Santa Cruz Mountains	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	Pinot Noir	Wrights Station 2013 Cave Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
8917	Portugal	A big-hearted, fruity wine. With its ripe tannins and red berry fruits, this red is certainly powerful, but it manages to keep its balance, finishing ripe and sweet. This is a wine that could be enjoyed now, but would certainly age over the next 4ƒ??5 years.		GT_90_Points	20	Douro			Roger Voss	Portuguese Red	Quinta do Passadouro 2005 Red (Douro)
8919	US	Showing the rustic tannins and peppery spices that Dry Creek Cabs usually possess, this Cab wants a little time in the cellar. 7041	US	Still quite young, but showing real depth and layering, the McCrone vineyard designate offers pomegranate and raspberry fruit, dusted with baking spices, and finished with a tasty vein of mocha. 7042	Germany	Truly stunning, this white starts out with subtle talcum powder and gravel notes, then adds intense perfume and peaches in the mouth. There's a finely tuned balance and good length. Exceptional harmony and intensity suggest it will improve for 15 years or more.	Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Sp??tlese	GT_90_Points	30	Mosel				Riesling	Markus Molitor 2008 Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Sp??tlese Riesling (Mosel)
6325	France	There is a yeasty autolytic touch of brioche that mixes with the vivid red-apple notes of the nose which also has subtle floral overtones. This lovely elegant sparkler has a very fine fizz and a very refreshing long dry finish.	Prestige Ros??	GT_90_Points	50	Alsace	Cr??mant d'Alsace		Anne Krebiehl?ÿMW	Sparkling Blend	Cave du Roi Dagobert NV Prestige Ros?? Sparkling (Cr??mant d'Alsace)
4514	US	The producer's Russian River Valley fruit comes from the Winside Vineyard, planted long ago by Anne Moller-Racke and Joe Nugent. It astounds in this must-have wine, complex and ridiculously velvety in texture. Pepper, clove and cardamom ride huge waves of baked fruit and mocha, with the structure to age through at least 2026, but why wait when it's so delicious now? 4515	Italy	95   Massolino 2012 Parafada (Barolo). A textbook Barolo, this opens with scents of mature berry, leather, underbrush, tobacco and an elegant trace of fragrant blue flower. The well-structured palate delivers succulent black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon, licorice, clove and mineral alongside a backbone of firm yet refined tannins. Drink 2020ƒ??2030. 6265	US	This is an enormous Cabernet, as packed with intensity and power as anything in Napa Valley. paragraphs.title: Show Lift Chart for Model Evaluation;   Looks Like a Good Predictive Model!
paragraphs.text:
%sql

--Show the Lift Chart for evaluating the model.
--Hint: Change the barchart to a line graph to see how good the model is.

SELECT A.QUANTILE_NUMBER, ROUND(A.GAIN_CUMULATIVE*100,2) GAIN_CUMULATIVE, B.RANDOM_GUESS
FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE A
, (SELECT QUANTILE_NUMBER, QUANTILE_NUMBER RANDOM_GUESS FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE) B
WHERE A.QUANTILE_NUMBER = B.QUANTILE_NUMBER;
Select * from DM$VLWINE_CLASS_MODEL_SVM;

paragraphs.title: Let's Explore the Wines that are predicted to be Good Wines
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- COST here refers to a machine learning modeling term and can be ignored
-- Explore the Wines that are predicted to be good wines.
-- Hint : Change the Prediction from the drop down to see the predictions for GT_90_Points / LT_90_Points

SELECT ID, PREDICTION, PROBABILITY FROM Wine_APPLY_RESULT WHERE PREDICTION = ${PREDICTION='GT_90_Points','GT_90_Points'|'LT_90_Points'} order by probability desc;

paragraphs.title: Show 1,000 Wines that are less than $15 and their predicted Points (looking for really inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Show 1000 Wines which are less than $15 and the predicted Points(looking for inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)

SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL_SVM USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 1000 and Price < 15) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database? Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!

Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

paragraphs.title: For Running this Notebook Again, Remove Any Previous WinePredictions Table

msg.data:
DROP TABLE WinePredictions PURGE: succeeded


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Create WinePredictions table in ADW for Access by Oracle Analytics Cloud
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Create table WinePredictons for viewing in Oracle Analytics Cloud

CREATE TABLE WinePredictions AS 
  SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL_SVM USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 100000 and Price < 500) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;
